properties.name: Social Sentinel
properties.short_description: Social Sentinel is a social media threat intelligence alert solution for college campuses, K-12 schools and public safety.
properties.description: Social Sentinel is a social media threat intelligence alert solution for college campuses, K-12 schools and public safety.

properties.bio:
With more than 20 years of distinguished experience in public safety and over a decade in higher education, serving as Chief of Police at the University of Vermont and State Agricultural College, Dr. Margolis brings a wealth of expertise to Campus Sentinel, Inc., having addressed a variety of K-12 and higher education safety and security issues including crises response and communications, security technology application, emergency response and recovery planning and preventing sexual and gender violence on campuses.

Prior to founding Campus Sentinel, Inc., Dr. Margolis served as a managing partner with Margolis Healy & Associates, LLC.

He has served as a police executive, police officer, deputy sheriff and police academy administrator. Often called upon by the US Departments of Justice, Education, and Homeland Security as a campus security expert, Dr. Margolis is a founding faculty member of the IACP National Law Enforcement Leadership Institute on Violence Against Women sponsored by the US Department of Justice, Office on Violence Against Women.

He serves as a Commissioner for the Commission on Accrediation of Law Enforcement Agencies (CALEA), which accredits police departments, training academies and public safety call centers in the United States, Canada and Mexico.

Spencer Newman is a seasoned executive with nearly twenty years of financial management experience working with organizations in the private and public sectors. He has managed non-existent to multi-million dollar budgets as well as grant and contract compliance between high-growth companies, local organizations and U.S. federal agencies. 

Spencer has served on the boards of the City of Burlington Municipal Electric Utility (Chairman), the University of Vermont’s Vtrim® Health Program, and privately-held local manufacturer, Nathaniel Group.

He is a graduate of the Kellogg School of Management and Tufts University, with an MBA and a BA in political science.

With more than 15 years experience in the educational technology market, Tom Motter was most recently a Partner and Senior Vice President at EveryPenny, LLC, an innovative web-based fundraising solution built for K-12 schools that provides complete administrative control over fundraising activities and significantly enhances a school’s ability to raise money.

Prior to EveryPenny, he was the President and Chief Operating Officer at  Blackboard Connect, Inc., a division of Blackboard, Inc., and the President of Connect-Ed, which served 20% of the US Education market with $45M in annual revenue prior to its acquisition by Blackboard in 2008.

Mr. Motter received his MBA in Information Technology and Marketing from the University of California at Irvine. A former U.S. Army Airborne Ranger who served in Vietnam and was awarded the Bronze Star and two Air Medals, he is a member of the Seal Beach Volunteers in Policing in Seal Beach, CA.

With more than seven years experience in technology sales in the education market, Alan was most recently a Senior Sales Executive at Blackboard, Inc., where he was personally responsible for prospecting and closing over $5.5 million dollars in new higher education business for the Connect platform.

Prior to Blackboard, Alan was the Regional Sales Director at NTI Group, the parent company of the Connect-ED service, until it was acquired by Blackboard in 2008.

He received his BA in Management Information Systems from the University of Oklahoma. Alan is fluent in four languages and lives in the Dallas area with his wife and three children. He enjoys spending his free time outdoor – fishing, hunting and camping.

Loredo Sola has more than 25 years of diverse software development experience. His ability to develop sophisticated architectures and translate this language into layman’s terms for business partners, customers and team members is an invaluable asset to the Campus Sentinel team.

As Director of Software Development for Sharecare/PKC Clinical Informatics, he led a team of developers to create a state-of-the-art smart phone and web-based virtual MD experience.

He was also a Senior Project Manager/Technology Architect for Volpe Research Center/Computer Sciences Corp. and a Managing Partner at Keene Systems Consulting Inc.

Loredo graduated from DePaul University with a BS in Math and Physics. He received his PMP certification in 2009. He is the Founding Chairman of Keep BT (Burlington Telecom) Local, a co-op initiative in Burlington, Vermont.

He was also the Founding Chairman of the ECFiber Governing Board in Central Vermont.

With more than 20 years of distinguished experience in public safety and over a decade in higher education, serving as Chief of Police at the University of Vermont and State Agricultural College, Dr. Margolis brings a wealth of expertise to Campus Sentinel, Inc., having addressed a variety of K-12 and higher education safety and security issues including crises response and communications, security technology application, emergency response and recovery planning and preventing sexual and gender violence on campuses.

Prior to founding Campus Sentinel, Inc., Dr. Margolis served as a managing partner with Margolis Healy & Associates, LLC.

He has served as a police executive, police officer, deputy sheriff and police academy administrator. Often called upon by the US Departments of Justice, Education, and Homeland Security as a campus security expert, Dr. Margolis is a founding faculty member of the IACP National Law Enforcement Leadership Institute on Violence Against Women sponsored by the US Department of Justice, Office on Violence Against Women.

He serves as a Commissioner for the Commission on Accrediation of Law Enforcement Agencies (CALEA), which accredits police departments, training academies and public safety call centers in the United States, Canada and Mexico.

properties.title: Director for Project Management and Client Relations

properties.bio:
Scott Brightwell, since 2012, has served as the Director for Project Management and Client Relations for Campus Sentinel, Inc, and Margolis Healy & Associates, a professional services firm specializing in campus safety, security and regulatory compliance for higher education and K-12.

He has extensive project management and technical integration experience, having served as a Project Manager and Upgrade Team leader at GE Healthcare, specializing in the client/engineering interface for installs and upgrades of Radiological Information Systems (RIS) and Picture Archive and Communication Systems (PACS) across hospitals in the United States and Canada.

Scott managed BETA testing of new software, 24/7 engineering resolution of severe disruptions of service across the United States, Canada, and Asia, and coordination of third party contractor services of infrastructure purchases and install.

He has BA and MFA degrees from Florida State University, and was a teacher and department head at the Studio Art Centers International in Florence, Italy.

Spencer Newman is a seasoned executive with nearly twenty years of financial management experience working with organizations in the private and public sectors. properties.title: Director for Project Management and Client Relations

properties.bio:
Scott Brightwell, since 2012, has served as the Director for Project Management and Client Relations for Campus Sentinel, Inc, and Margolis Healy & Associates, a professional services firm specializing in campus safety, security and regulatory compliance for higher education and K-12.

He has extensive project management and technical integration experience, having served as a Project Manager and Upgrade Team leader at GE Healthcare, specializing in the client/engineering interface for installs and upgrades of Radiological Information Systems (RIS) and Picture Archive and Communication Systems (PACS) across hospitals in the United States and Canada.

Scott managed BETA testing of new software, 24/7 engineering resolution of severe disruptions of service across the United States, Canada, and Asia, and coordination of third party contractor services of infrastructure purchases and install.

He has BA and MFA degrees from Florida State University, and was a teacher and department head at the Studio Art Centers International in Florence, Italy.

Natasha Conahan serves as chief strategy officer of Social Sentinel and at the same time founder and CEO of BetterServed, Inc. Most recently, she was the CBO of Blackboard and The NTI Group. She also served as VP of operations at Vivendi Universal from 2001 to 2003.

Natasha holds a BA in Japanese studies from University of California, San Diego.

properties.name: FreshTracks Capital
properties.short_description: FreshTracks is an early stage venture capital firm currently investing out of its 2016 vintage FreshTracks IV Fund.
properties.description: FreshTracks is a seed & early stage venture capital firm focused on financing businesses in Vermont and surrounding regions. The firm was founded in 2000, and is currently investing out of its 2016 vintage FreshTracks IV Fund, which is managed by co-founder Cairn Cross, T.J. Whalen & Lee Bouyea.  FreshTracks’ expertise, networks, resources and capital support innovative businesses through multiple rounds of financing and stages of growth.

properties.bio: Kenneth Hertz, is a Senior Partner in the Beverly Hills law firm of Hertz Lichtenstein & Young LLP. Ken and his partners specialize in representing talent and new media companies in the sports and entertainment industries. The firm's clients include Will, Jada, Willow and Jaden Smith, No Doubt, Gwen Stefani, The Black Eyed Peas, will.i.am, Keith Richards, Herbie Hancock, Jason Mraz, Britney Spears, Janet Jackson, David Blaine, Shaun White, Wayne Gretzky, Jamie Oliver, James Patterson, Lionel Richie and Enrique Iglesias. Prior to joining the firm, Ken was in charge of music -- business and legal affairs -- for The Walt Disney Company. Ken is also a principal in memBrain - an entertainment marketing and strategy consulting firm. memBrain's clients include Hasbro, McDonald's, Intel, MillerCoors, Fossil, and Coty.
